result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis E Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 09-01-2015.  Failure to be paid 15 days Jail.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations after one year.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis E Meyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction signed and filed
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dennis E Meyer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine and costs of $ 1355.50 or alternate of 15 days. Defendant to pay $100.00 a month commencing 09/01/2015. 
 Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations after one year.

Defendant Dennis E Meyer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is working on reaching resolution with the State. Court adjourns case.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amy C Scholz in court.   Defendant Dennis E Meyer did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Atty Scholz has been retained by the Defendant.

Defendant Dennis E Meyer in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant would like time to speak with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Dennis E Meyer in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
